summary: This document is a chain of emails between attorneys at Winston & Strawn LLP and federal prosecutors regarding a grand jury subpoena issued on July 5, 2019. The emails discuss scheduling meetings, providing evidence (including transcripts and phone records), and negotiating a potential voluntary interview for a client, who is implied to be a person of interest in the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Suzanne Jaffe Bloom
persons.role: Partner at Winston & Strawn LLP, Defense Attorney
persons.context: She is the lead attorney corresponding with federal prosecutors regarding a grand jury subpoena issued to her client, negotiating meeting times and evidence disclosure.

persons.name: Johanna Rae Hudgens
persons.role: Associate Attorney at Winston & Strawn LLP
persons.context: She is cc'd on the emails, assists with scheduling meetings, and confirms logistics for attorney meetings with prosecutors.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in passing as the subject of related civil cases in federal court in Florida, providing context for the broader investigation.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Winston & Strawn LLP working together on the defense of a client subpoenaed by the SDNY grand jury.
Bloom is formally retained and representing a client who received a grand jury subpoena dated July 5, 2019, and is negotiating a potential voluntary interview on their behalf.

events.title: SDNY Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: A grand jury subpoena is issued by the Southern District of New York, initiating the legal process discussed in the emails.

events.title: Original Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The initial date the subpoena required the client to appear before the grand jury; this date was adjourned and held in abeyance pending discussions.

events.title: Proposed Meeting Date
events.description: A meeting is proposed between the defense attorneys (Bloom and Hudgens) and the federal prosecution team to discuss the case.

events.title: Confirmed Attorney Meeting
events.description: A meeting is confirmed for 9:30 a.m. between the defense team and the prosecution team.

locations: 200 Park Avenue, New York, NY 10166-4193 (Winston & Strawn LLP office)
Florida (mentioned as location of federal civil cases involving Jeffrey Epstein)
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued by the SDNY on July 5, 2019, to an unnamed client represented by Winston & Strawn LLP.

Prosecutors informed the defense that they possess contemporaneous telephone records from a cell phone registered to the client, which show "numerous phone contacts with multiple girls who were underage at the time of the calls."
The parties were negotiating a potential voluntary interview for the client, and the original grand jury appearance date of July 24, 2019, was held in abeyance.
The prosecution provided the defense with docket numbers for related civil cases, including cases under the Crime Victims' Rights Act (CVRA).
The email chain shows active coordination and evidence sharing between federal prosecutors and defense counsel in the early stages of the SDNY Epstein investigation.
